Concept ACK and the code looks neat.\nThe `CTRL+D` shortcut is not common for Windows users. And the GUI should somehow inform a user about it.

I guess this is OS specific.
On macOS, `cmd-W` does close windows within an app (works almost with all apps including strange java cross platform apps like "Arduino-IDE",... but not with Bitcoin-Qt).

However, concept ACK on working on shortcuts to close windows.

Concept ACK, going to test\n\n(though I share with @jonasschnelli  a slight preference for Ctrl-W as well for closing *any* subwindow, due to FF browser tabs, but have no problem with Ctrl-D doing the same here, there's already a PR for that anyhow #15768)

@jonasschnelli does ctrl+w closes any window?\nThe idea behind it was only to close a terminal window and the bitcoin-qt terminal window is one. I think the Ctrl+D shortcut is common for unix terminals
Correction, it sends EOF to the shell prompt, which then terminates, which can result in the window close.
Sure but this effectively closes a terminal (at least on unix(-like) systems)

IIRC someone said that this does not send a EOF to the terminal, it "only" closes the terminal.\nI meant that your implementation is fine for this.\nSorry I sometimes have problems to justify myself :(
